meanings.definition: A photograph taken by an early photographic process in which a positive image is made on a copper plate coated with a dark lacquer.
meanings.sent1: The old tintype showed a family smiling together.
meanings.sent2: I found a tintype of my great-grandparents in the attic.
meanings.sent3: At the antique shop, I saw a tintype of a cowboy with a funny hat.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like a tintype, capturing moments frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The tintype of the historic building was a valuable find for the museum.

meanings.definition: To take a photograph using the tintype process.
meanings.sent1: He decided to tintype the beautiful landscape before the sun set.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to tintype during her photography class.
meanings.sent3: The photographer tintyped the group of friends at the park, making them pose like models.
meanings.sent4: His passion was to tintype nature's beauty in all its glory.
meanings.sent5: Tintyping the cityscape at night required special skills and techniques.
